author: Callum Davis
title: Ex-Chelsea footballer wins £5.5m Lotto jackpot
text: An ex-Chelsea footballer has won £5.5m from playing the National Lottery. Terry Bradbury, 75, was the sole winner from Saturday night's Lotto draw, collecting a total of £5,517,056. • The top 100 summer transfer targets The National Lottery took to Twitter to announce the identity of the winner, and congratulate Terry and his wife: Meet Terry & Eleanor Bradbury from Buxton, who've won last Saturday's £5.5million #Lotto jackpot! RT to congratulate! pic.twitter.com/7QVYkHmb2B — The National Lottery (@TNLUK) July 8, 2015 Bradbury, who made no more than £25-a-week as a professional footballer, represented Chelsea alongside Terry Venables and Jimmy Greaves. The ex-midfielder, from Buxton, Derbyshire, said: "The news really is still sinking in. We still can't quite believe it." Terry Bradbury earned a mere £25 per week Bradbury began his career with Chelsea in 1957 and made 29 appearances for the First Division club. He moved to Southend United in 1962 for a reported £6,000 before going on to play for Leyton Orient. Bradbury moved to Wrexham in 1967 before joining rivals Chester, and later worked as a player-coach at Weymouth. • 'Mad' lottery draw: three winning numbers pays out more than four The former footballer, who also made appearances for Leyton Oreint and Southend, says that he plans to use the winnings to buy a villa in Spain. Terry Bradbury in his Chelsea days Terry Bradbury's wife, Eleanor, said: "the villa will be a place where our family can always go on holiday". "This win will provide our family with security for the future." • Lottery changes: Is it now easier to become a millionaire? The couple revealed that they purchased the ticket in a lucky dip from a local WH Smith near their home in Buxton - see them showing off their lucky balls below: Terry and Eleanor show off their lucky (dip) balls! #MeetAWinner pic.twitter.com/gJWzOveP6V — The National Lottery (@TNLUK) July 8, 2015 Follow @telefootball
